common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Me llamo María y tengo dieciséis años.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: My name is María and I'm sixteen years old.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: Always add extra information to show language skills.

common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Vivo en Nueva York con mi familia.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: I live in New York with my family.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: Mention ciudad (city) or país (country) for extra detail.

common_oral_exam_questions.question_spanish: ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
common_oral_exam_questions.question_english: What do you like to do in your free time?
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Me gusta leer libros y jugar fútbol con mis amigos.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: I like to read books and play soccer with my friends.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: Use 'me gusta' for singular activities, 'me gustan' for plural.

common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Mi comida favorita es la pizza porque es deliciosa.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: My favorite food is pizza because it's delicious.

common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Sí, tengo un hermano mayor y una hermana menor.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: Yes, I have an older brother and a younger sister.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: Mayor = older, menor = younger. Hermano = brother, hermana = sister.

common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Estudio matemáticas, ciencias e historia. Mi clase favorita es matemáticas.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: I study math, science and history. My favorite class is math.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: List multiple subjects to show vocabulary range.

common_oral_exam_questions.question_english: Where did you go on vacation?
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Fui a México el verano pasado. Fue muy divertido.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: I went to Mexico last summer. It was very fun.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: Use past tense: fui (I went), fue (it was).

common_oral_exam_questions.question_english: What do you want to do in the future?
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_spanish: Quiero ser médico y ayudar a las personas.
common_oral_exam_questions.sample_answer_english: I want to be a doctor and help people.
common_oral_exam_questions.tips: Use 'quiero ser' (I want to be) + profession.

exam_strategies.explanation: Never give one-word answers. Always expand with porque (because), y (and), pero (but).
exam_strategies.example: Instead of 'Me gusta el fútbol', say 'Me gusta el fútbol porque es emocionante y juego con mis amigos'.

exam_strategies.explanation: Show you know different tenses by using time words.
If appropriate, ask the examiner a question to show conversational skills.
exam_strategies.example: After answering, you can say '¿Y usted?' (And you?)

exam_strategies.strategy: Don't panic if you don't understand
exam_strategies.explanation: It's OK to ask for clarification.

pronunciation_tips_for_exams.explanation: Practice words like 'perro' (dog) and 'carro' (car). The double R is rolled.
Unlike English, every vowel is pronounced clearly in Spanish.
Words starting with H are pronounced without the H sound.
The letter J is pronounced like a strong H in English.

study_schedule_suggestions.daily_practice: 15-20 minutes daily is better than 2 hours once a week

before_exam.1_week_before: Practice common questions daily. Record yourself speaking.
before_exam.3_days_before: Focus on pronunciation. Speak slowly and clearly.
before_exam.1_day_before: Review your notes. Get good sleep. Don't cram!
before_exam.exam_day: Relax. Speak confidently. It's OK to make small mistakes.

practice_tips: Practice with SpeedSpeak daily for instant feedback
Talk to yourself in Spanish while doing daily activities
Watch Spanish YouTube videos with subtitles
Label objects around your room with Spanish names
Join a Spanish conversation group or language exchange
